You can create an TrueRange indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the TrueRange constructor.

TrueRange()1/2

            TrueRange QuantConnect.Indicators.TrueRange (
   )

Initializes a new instance of the TrueRange class using the specified name.

Parameters
This constructor does not take any argument.

Return

TrueRange - The new TrueRange indicator object.

Definition at line 34 of file Indicators/TrueRange.cs.

            TrueRange QuantConnect.Indicators.TrueRange (
     string  name
   )

Initializes a new instance of the TrueRange class using the specified name.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.

Return

TrueRange - The new TrueRange indicator object.

Definition at line 43 of file Indicators/TrueRange.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.


private TrueRange _tr;

// In Initialize()
_tr = new TrueRange(name);
_tr.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _tr, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_tr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _tr.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.tr = TrueRange(name)
self.tr.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.tr, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.tr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.tr.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar, QuoteBar, or an IndicatorDataPoint. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

    
private TrueRange _tr;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_tr = new TrueRange();
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _tr.Update(data.QuoteBars[symbol]);
}
if (_tr.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _tr.Current.Value;
}
    
# In Initialize()
self.tr = TrueRange()
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.QuoteBars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.tr.Update(data.QuoteBars[self.symbol])
if self.tr.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.tr.Current.Value
